data.sampled:
Per rectum examination is not a useful test for diagnosis of:
a) Anal fissure,
b) Hemorrhoid,
c) Pilonidal sinus,
d) Rectal ulcer.</s> 
What are some other diagnostic methods that doctors may use to diagnose rectal conditions?</s> 
Other diagnostic methods that doctors may use to diagnose rectal conditions include:

1. Colonoscopy: This procedure is designed for retrieving tissue biopsies and relievingly viewing the entire colon with the assistance of a flexible camera.

2. Colposcopy: This is a colposcopic examination of the cervix to search for any signs of abnormal cells.

3. Ultrasound: This procedure checks the colon for any abnormalities using sound waves to provide a better scope of view.

4. Rectal examination: This is a traditional physical examination that can check the rectal area, looking for signs of hemorrhoids, or anything unusual such as abnormal growths or lumps.

5. MRI/CT scans: These imaging techniques can be used to provide a detailed visualization of the rectum, to visualize the walls surrounding the rectum, and to visualize any abnormalities present.
